intro: Farsetia somalensis, commonly known as the Somali farsetia, is a flowering plant native to the Horn of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and narrow, leathery leaves. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, adapting to harsh conditions with its succulent stems. It is often found in rocky soils and is well-suited to dry climates. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
